TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract WeakEventManager extends System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject
Public MustInherit Class WeakEventManager Inherits DispatcherObject

summary.span: Provides a base class for the event manager that is used in the *weak event pattern*.

span.span: Provides a base class for the event manager that is used in the *weak event pattern*.

summary.span: The manager adds and removes listeners for events (or callbacks) that also use the pattern.

span.span: The manager adds and removes listeners for events (or callbacks) that also use the pattern.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当事件源具有对象生存期无关的事件侦听器时，通常使用弱事件模式。You typically use the weak event pattern when the event source has an object lifetime that is independent of the event listeners. 使用中央事件调度能力允许该侦听器的处理程序进行垃圾回收，即使源对象仍然存在。Using the central event dispatching capability of a allows the listener's handlers to be garbage collected even if the source object persists. 与此相反，常规事件挂钩使用`+=`运算符会导致可能断开连接的源来保存到侦听器的引用。By contrast, a regular event hookup using the `+=` operator causes the potentially disconnected source to hold a reference to the listeners. 这可以防止接收方进行垃圾回收及时。This prevents the receiver from being garbage collected in a timely fashion. 一种常见情况之间源和侦听器的生存期关系应使用其中的弱事件模式是来自数据绑定的更新事件的处理。One common situation where the lifetime relationships between sources and listeners should use of the weak event pattern is the handling of update events coming from data bindings. 弱事件模式还可以用于回调事件和常规事件。The weak event pattern can also be used for callbacks and regular events.

span.para: 有关自定义的示例，请参阅 [弱事件 Patterns](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/weak-event-patterns.md)。
For an example of a custom , see [Weak Event Patterns](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/weak-event-patterns.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用从方法中的事件处理程序添加或移除和子类的实现。Call the method from within the event handlers that are added or removed by the and implementations of subclasses. 如果调用方法在你`AddListener`实现你的类中，侦听器接收事件的列表就会保留在基础集合。If you call the method in your `AddListener` implementation of your class, the list of listeners receiving the event is kept in an underlying collection. (`AddListener`不是类或接口协定的一部分。(`AddListener` is not part of an interface or class contract. `AddListener` 是管理器的类中调用的方法的建议的名称并添加为事件弱事件模式侦听器。)`AddListener` is the suggested name for the method of your manager class that calls and adds weak event pattern listeners for the event.) 将侦听器添加到一个列表。 adds listeners to a single list. 如果你管理器实现维护多个列表的每个事件侦听器，则不要使用或。If your manager implementation maintains more than one list of listeners per event, do not use or . 相反，你实现应创建其自己情况下，`AddListener`应将侦听器添加到相应的列表中，并且事件应通过调用传递到相应的侦听器列表。Instead, your implementation should create its own instances, `AddListener` should add listeners to the appropriate list, and events should be delivered to the appropriate listener list by calling .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是必需的如果您管理器的实现维护单独的侦听器列表根据捕获事件数据中的信息。This method is necessary if your manager implementation maintains separate listeners lists based on information that is captured in the event data. 如果你使用此高级的技术，必须创建并维护属于管理器实现，将单独的列表，你必须提供了如何将侦听器添加到的特定列表。If you use this advanced technique, you must create and maintain the separate lists as part of your manager implementation, and you must provide a way to add listeners to a specific list. 您侦听原始事件的处理程序实现的行为必须在条件时，使用来区分列表中，并将事件传送仅对的相应的列表或列表。Your handler implementation that listens to the raw event must act upon the condition that you use to differentiate the lists, and deliver the event only to the appropriate list or lists.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 派生的类可以选择数据和将存储在此索引器的类型。Derived classes can choose what data and type to store in this indexer. 通常这作为实现，这是一份到侦听器的弱引用。Typically this is implemented as a , which is a list of weak references to listeners. 你只需更改此类型，如果类型不能包含你所需的信息。You would only have to change this type if the type cannot contain your required information. 如果这样，你将需要重写方法，以便正确执行的基础类型的所有清理。If so, you will have to override the method so that all cleanup of the underlying type is performed correctly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法内管理器类`AddListener`方法实现。Call this method within your manager class `AddListener` methods on implementations. `AddListener` 是建议的名称的静态方法在上定义的管理器类，允许其他类来添加侦听器为弱事件模式。`AddListener` is the suggested name for the static method you define on your manager class to enable other classes to add a listener for your weak event pattern. `AddListener` 应采用两个参数：`source`附加侦听器，其中和`listener`实例。`AddListener` should take two parameters: the `source` where the listener is attached, and the `listener` instance. 为你`AddListener`实现，请调用上的当前管理器和传递相同的两个参数的方法。For your `AddListener` implementation, call the method on the current manager and pass the same two parameters. 如果侦听器的列表是先前为空，调用方法内部，这将调用您的特定多态性通过重写。If the list of listeners was previously empty, calls the method internally, which will call your specific override through polymorphism. 将侦听器添加到单个内部每`source`。 adds listeners to a single internal per `source`. 如果你管理器实现维护的侦听器的每个事件源组合的多个列表，请不要使用。If your manager implementation maintains more than one list of listeners for each event-source combination, do not use . 相反，你实现应创建其自己情况下，`AddListener`应将侦听器添加到相应的列表中，并且事件应通过调用传递到相应的侦听器列表而不是事件方法。Instead, your implementation should create its own instances, `AddListener` should add listeners to the appropriate list, and events should be delivered to the appropriate listener list by calling the event instead of the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法内管理器类`RemoveListener`方法实现。Call this method within your manager class `RemoveListener` methods on implementations. `RemoveListener` 是建议的名称的静态方法在上定义的管理器类，允许其他类以删除侦听器为弱事件模式。`RemoveListener` is the suggested name for the static method you define on your manager class to enable other classes to remove a listener for your weak event pattern. `RemoveListener` 应采用两个参数：`source`其中删除侦听器，则与`listener`类。`RemoveListener` should take two parameters: the `source` where the listener is removed, and the `listener` class. 为你`RemoveListener`实现，请调用上的当前管理器和传递相同的两个参数的方法。For your `RemoveListener` implementation, call the method on the current manager and pass the same two parameters. 如果调用在列表中，删除最后一个侦听器调用方法内部，这将调用您的特定多态性通过重写。If a call to removes the last listener in the list, calls the method internally, which will call your specific override through polymorphism. 从单个内部中删除侦听器每`source`。 removes listeners from a single internal per `source`. 如果你管理器实现维护的侦听器的每个事件源组合的多个列表，请不要使用。If your manager implementation maintains more than one list of listeners for each event-source combination, do not use . 相反，你实现应创建其自己情况下，`RemoveListener`应从相应的列表中删除侦听器和事件应通过调用传递到相应的侦听器列表方法而不是方法。Instead, your implementation should create its own instances, `RemoveListener` should remove listeners from the appropriate list, and events should be delivered to the appropriate listener list by calling the method instead of the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法具有一个默认实现，数据时，将删除所有条目。The method has a default implementation that will remove all entries when data is a .

span.para: 如果的基础类型而不是，或包含超过数据，必须重写方法。重写应为清除行为提供替代类型项列表。通常情况下，重写应提供行为，而不会调用基实现。如果特定仍然需要清除，请调用。

If the underlying type for the is something other than , or contains data beyond a , you must override the method. The override should provide purge behavior for the alternate type items list. Generally, the override should provide behavior without calling the base implementation. If a specific still needs clearing, call .

summary.span: Establishes a read-lock on the underlying data table, and returns an .

span.span: Establishes a read-lock on the underlying data table, and returns an .

value.span: 用于建立数据表成员上的锁，然后相应地释放与对象构造。

span.span: An object that can be used to establish a lock on the data table members and then be appropriately disposed with a construct.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在派生类中，查询中包含的表应总是出现在`using (ReadLock) { ... }`子句，除非已内的写入锁的查询。In derived classes, queries to the table contained in should always occur within a `using (ReadLock) { ... }` clause, except for queries that are already within a write lock. 这些查询可能有必要，如果你的类支持更复杂`AddListener`实施，需要更多的数据超出`source`和`listener`，并使用用于存储的额外信息集合。These queries may be necessary if your class supports a more sophisticated `AddListener` implementation that requires more data beyond the `source` and the `listener`, and uses the collection to store the extra information.

summary.span: Requests that a purge of unused entries in the underlying listener list be performed on a lower priority thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用方法是类似于调用当前管理器的列表，以较低的线程优先级，方法与`purgeAll`参数设置为`false`。Calling the method is similar to calling the method on the current manager's list, at lower thread priority, with the `purgeAll` parameter set to `false`.

span.para: 重写应将处理程序添加到提供。通过对管理器本身可声明处理程序。类处理程序不应为公共的且它仅应调用以响应被托管的事件。类处理程序应调用方法或方法相应地。

overrides should add a handler to the provided . The handler is declared by the manager itself. The class handler should not be public, and it should only be called in response to the event being managed. The class handler should call the method or the method appropriately.

span.para: 实现应移除类处理程序，通过添加方法。删除侦听器不应清除侦听器列表。相反，它应仅断开连接的类处理程序 （可能是暂时的）。其他方法都可用于清除整个列表，如方法替换参数设置为。

implementations should remove the class handler as added by the method. Removing a listener should not clear the listener list. Instead, it should only disconnect the class handler (perhaps temporarily). Other methods are available for clearing the entire list, such as the method with the parameter set to .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在派生类中，对与基础数据表的所有修改应都发生在`using (WriteLock) { ... }`子句。In derived classes, all modifications to the underlying data table should occur within a `using (WriteLock) { ... }` clause. 这些修改可能有必要，如果你的类支持更复杂`AddListener`实施，需要更多的数据超出`source`和`listener`，并使用用于存储的额外信息集合。These modifications may be necessary if your class supports a more sophisticated `AddListener` implementation that requires more data beyond the `source` and the `listener`, and uses the collection to store the extra information.
